contentrichtext.text: This was [[Zimbabwe]]'s first [[National anthem|anthem]] after gaining independence in 1980. It is a translation of 19th century South African schoolteacher [[Enoch Sontonga]]'s popular African hymn [[Nkosi Sikelel' iAfrika]] (God Bless Africa) into Zimbabwe's native [[Shona language|Shona]] and [[Ndebele language]]s{{dn|date=March 2013}}.<ref>http://www.nationalanthems.info/zw-94.htm</ref> It was replaced as the national anthem of Zimbabwe in 1994 by [[Kalibusiswe Ilizwe leZimbabwe]] (Blessed be the land of Zimbabwe), but remains very popular in the country.<ref>http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/3906619.stm</ref> ==Shona Words== :Ishekomborera Africa<br />Ngaisimudzirwe zita rayo<br />Inzwai miteuro yedu<br />Ishe komborera,<br />Isu, mhuri yayo.<br />Huya mweya<br />Huya mweya komborera<br />(repeat previous two lines)<br />Huya mweya<br />Huya mweya woutsvene<br />Uti komborere<br />Isu mhuri yayo. ==English Words== :God bless Africa,<br />Let her fame spread far and wide!<br />Hear our prayer,<br />May God bless us!<br />Come, Spirit, come!<br />Come! Holy Spirit!<br />Come and bless us, her children! ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Historical national anthems]]
